intro: Codonanthopsis anisophylla, commonly known as the variable moss campion, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and dry landscapes.
